roleset.name: cover with a liquid, to fill with an excess, filling past capacity with liquid
roleset.note: FLOOD-V NOTES: Frames file for 'flood' based on survey of sentences in the WSJ corpus. (from flood.01-v)
FLOOD-N NOTES: Based on sentences in nouns-00040. Comparison to flood.01-V. See Vn clases fill-9.8 and other_cos-45.4. Framed by Katie. (from flood.01-n)
FLOODING-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT, flood-v.01. Corresponds to VNcls fill-9.8, other_cos-45.4. (from flooding.01-n)

example.name: flood-v: all arguments
example.text: When Mrs. Thatcher cut the top tax rate to 40 % [*T*-1] , Mr. Lawson flooded the country with money [*-2]to prevent the pound from [*-3] rising against the mark .
example.arg: When Mrs. Thatcher cut the top tax rate to 40 % [*T*-1]
[*-2] to prevent the pound from [*-3]rising against the mark

example.name: flood-v: passive
example.text: In 1984 , the Costa Rican government requested help [*] to establish a radio station in [the northern part]-1 of the country , flooded [*]-1 by airwaves of Sandinista propaganda .

example.name: flood-n: arg 1
example.text: a flood of selling by other investors

example.name: flood-n: finding more than arg 1 may be rare
flooding-n: Args 1, 2
example.text: It is often necessary to raise mounds or dykes along the course of rivers to keep them within their channels, and prevent their flooding the lands which lie near them, when the waters rise above their usual level.
example.arg: the lands which lie near them
when the waters rise above their usual level
